article.headline: Grambling State beats Selma 74-64
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- A'Torri Shine hit five 3-pointers and scored 28 points to lead Grambling State past NAIA Selma on Saturday night. Mark Gary added 15 points and grabbed 12 rebounds for Grambling State (3-5). The Tigers hit 8 of 17 3-pointers. Adrian Nelson led Selma with 23 points and eight rebounds. Johnathan Bentley had 12 and Josh Stallworth added 11 points and nine rebounds. Selma was held to 23-of-61 shooting (37.7 percent) and were outrebounded 41-30. Selma was within 51-50 with 13:19 left, but Carlton Lowe scored six points during an 8-0 run to pull away. Grambling State was down 16-10, but Shine started an 11-0 run with three consecutive 3-pointers.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
